avalancheActivity.comment:
The large wind slabs can be released even by a single winter sport participant. This applies especially in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain in particular at high altitude at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack.
Avalanches can in isolated cases penetrate deep layers and reach large size.
In starting zones where no previous releases have taken place and on very steep sunny slopes medium-sized and large natural avalanches are possible as a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation. This applies in particular at low and intermediate altitudes.
The current avalanche situation calls for experience in the assessment of avalanche danger and caution.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Fresh wind slabs at high altitude. Moist and wet avalanches are to be expected as a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation.

snowpackStructure.comment: The fresh snow of the weekend and the wind slabs to be found in particular at intermediate and high altitudes are poorly bonded with the old snowpack in some places. Faceted weak layers exist deeper in the old snowpack in particular on shady slopes. Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise from early morning to rapid moistening of the snowpack in particular at low and intermediate altitudes. On steep sunny slopes numerous medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large avalanches were observed.

avalancheActivity.comment:
The moderate wind has transported the new snow. The fresh wind slabs can be released, even by a single winter sport participant and reach large size. This applies especially in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain in particular at intermediate and high altitudes, and on steep slopes above the tree line.
In particular on steep shady slopes avalanches can be released in deep layers of the snowpack.
As a consequence of warming and solar radiation, the natural avalanche activity will gradually increase. This applies in particular on sunny slopes below approximately 2300 m, and in steep rocky terrain.
Backcountry touring and other off-piste activities call for experience and restraint.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Fresh wind slabs at high altitude. Moist and wet avalanches are to be expected as a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation.

snowpackStructure.comment: The new snow and wind slabs of the weekend are poorly bonded with the old snowpack at intermediate and high altitudes. Faceted weak layers exist deeper in the old snowpack in particular on shady slopes. Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise from early morning to increasing moistening of the snowpack in particular at low and intermediate altitudes.

avalancheActivity.comment:
The sometimes moderate wind has transported the new snow significantly. The large wind slabs can be released even by a single winter sport participant. This applies especially in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain in particular at intermediate and high altitudes.
Avalanches can also penetrate deep layers and reach large size.
Whumpfing sounds and the formation of shooting cracks when stepping on the snowpack can indicate the danger.
In starting zones where no previous releases have taken place and on very steep sunny slopes medium-sized and large natural avalanches are possible as a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation. This applies in particular at low and intermediate altitudes.
The current avalanche situation calls for experience in the assessment of avalanche danger and caution.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Fresh wind slabs at high altitude. Moist and wet avalanches are to be expected as a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation.

snowpackStructure.comment: The new snow and wind slabs of the weekend are poorly bonded with the old snowpack at intermediate and high altitudes. Faceted weak layers exist deeper in the old snowpack in particular on shady slopes. On steep slopes medium-sized and large avalanches were observed. Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise from early morning to rapid moistening of the snowpack in particular at low and intermediate altitudes.

avalancheActivity.comment: The fresh wind slabs are in some cases quite large and can be released by large loads in particular, especially on steep slopes at high altitude adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls. As a consequence of warming and solar radiation, the natural avalanche activity will gradually increase. This applies in particular on sunny slopes below approximately 2200 m, and in steep rocky terrain. Be careful, many rocks hidden by fresh snow.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Moist and wet avalanches are to be expected as a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation. Fresh wind slabs at high altitude.

snowpackStructure.comment:
As a consequence of new snow and a moderate to strong wind, sometimes large wind slabs formed in the last few days. Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise from early morning to increasing moistening of the snowpack in particular at low and intermediate altitudes.
Above the tree line snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind.

As a consequence of warming and solar radiation, the natural avalanche activity will gradually increase. This applies in particular on sunny slopes below approximately 2300 m, and in steep rocky terrain. Be careful, many rocks hidden by fresh snow.

As a consequence of new snow and a moderate to strong wind, sometimes large wind slabs formed in the last few days. Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise from early morning to increasing moistening of the snowpack in particular at low and intermediate altitudes.
